official_title: To permit lawfully admitted permanent resident aliens who are not less than 80 years of age and who reside in the United States continuously for not less than 50 years to receive food stamp benefits if such individuals are otherwise eligible under the Food Stamp Act of 1977 to receive such benefits.

summary.text: Hardship Act of 1997 - Amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Act of 1996 to make certain elderly permanent resident aliens eligible for food stamp and supplemental security income benefits.
